policy_text: All development must be of an appropriate quality of design and respect local character.
Support housing on rural exception sites where it meets identified local need.
Minimum space standards apply. Parking requirements: 2 spaces per dwelling.
Housing development should achieve minimum density of 30 dph unless character dictates otherwise.
Development must respond to character and context, with high quality architecture.
Inappropriate development in the Green Belt will not be approved except in very special circumstances.
Affordable housing will be sought on residential schemes above threshold.
Development should make best use of land and support housing delivery.
Provide a mix of house types and sizes appropriate to local needs.
Development must achieve high quality design and enhance local distinctiveness.
